oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Pvt. W. E. Clemmons to Sarah Jane Bettis
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter from Pvt. William E. Clemmons, Co. K, 7th Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA, to Sarah Jane Bettis, later his wife Sarah Jane Clemmons Johnson. Clemmons was a Wilson County man. Letter sent from Camp Trousdale, a Confederate training camp in Sumner County: "I have still hope and look forward for that day when there will be peace and happiness in our glorious land." A courting letter written in the first flush of enlistment before combat, he says "I may fall in the glorious struggle of our rights.
